title: Platform Service Manifest
description: Defines a service, its infrastructure components, and their configuration for deployment via the platform.

service.description: The unique name of the service (e.g., 'order-api').

owner.description: The team or individual that owns this service (e.g., 'team-fulfillment').

runtime.description: The primary application runtime for the service (e.g., 'nodejs20').

labels.description: A map of key-value pairs for service discovery and categorization.

components.description: The list of infrastructure components that make up this service.

environmentConfiguration.description: Configuration defaults for different environments (e.g., dev, qa, prod).

$ref.description: A relative path to an external YAML or JSON file containing environment definitions.
A relative path to a file for a specific environment's configuration.

defaults.description: Default values for this environment, accessible via ${env:key} interpolation.

name.description: A unique name for this component instance within the service.

type.description: The type of component to create (e.g., 'rds-postgres', 'lambda-api').

config.description: Component-specific configuration. The schema is defined by the component itself.

labels.description: A map of key-value pairs for this specific component instance.

overrides.description: Fine-grained overrides for the component's underlying resources.

to.description: The name of the target component to bind to.

capability.description: The capability of the target to connect to (e.g., 'db:postgres').

env.description: Optional custom names for injected environment variables.

withLabels.description: A map of labels that the target component must match.

patches.description: Registration of programmatic patches from the 'patches.ts' file for audit purposes.

name.description: The name of the exported function in 'patches.ts' to apply.

justification.description: A required, human-readable reason for using the escape hatch.

owner.description: The team or individual responsible for this patch.

expiresOn.description: An ISO 8601 date (YYYY-MM-DD) after which this patch is considered expired and will fail validation.
